title: Workshop on Difficult Conversations and Collaborative Problem-Solving for Adult Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic adult learning theory and fundamental communication skills in workplace settings
context.additional_context: Learners are practicing professionals with advanced mathematical expertise who engage in case-based learning reflecting workplace conflicts and complex interpersonal issues. Reflective journaling using digital devices (tablets/laptops) is incorporated.

learning_goals: Learners can structure difficult conversations in real job situations by applying the six stages of the ORANGE framework: Observe, Respect, Assume, Navigate, Generate, and Empower.
Learners can perform self-reflection in conflict situations using reflective tools (templates/checklists) and develop dialogue strategies that foster psychological safety.
Learners can develop collaborative problem-solving scenarios through peer feedback and propose practical approaches to integrate mathematical thinking into the dialogue process.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
